title: Euro stands tall as investors bet recovery hampers dollar, stocks up
text: The euro stood at an 18-month high, silver soared and commodities forged ahead on Wednesday, as economic recovery hopes drove bets on rebounding world demand and a falling U.S. dollar.

title: Trump weighs in on economy, stock market during press conference
text: President Trump touts 'good day' for stock market claiming it was due to positive coronavirus news.

title: Oil prices fall on U.S. inventory build, increasing pandemic fears
text: Oil prices fell on Wednesday as industry data showed a bigger- than-expected inventory build in the United States where coronavirus cases continue to climb, potentially further denting demand in the world's biggest oil consumer.

title: Citi's Morse Recommends ETFs for Gold Exposure
text: Ed Morse, global head of commodities research at Citigroup Inc., talks about gold, silver, oil and carbon pricing. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: Stock Market Outlook: The Bulls Are Still Dancing (and Running)
text: The S&P 500 Index rose by 0.17% today to its highest level in about 5 months.

title: Asia markets to open lower on pandemic worries, shrugging off U.S. equities upswing
text: Asia shares were set to open lower on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump's comments regarding the country's surge in novel coronavirus cases outweighed a slight rally on Wall Street.

title: Trump's endorsement of face masks caused a rally in recovery stocks, Jim Cramer says
text: President Donald Trump's promotion of mask-wearing can help the U.S. flatten the curve and return the country to some sense of normal, the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Jim Cramer: The recovery plays have a new reason to rally
text: The U.S. can beat the coronavirus before a Covid-19 vaccine is developed if enough people wear face coverings, the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Virus relief package must cost at least $1.5 trillion to ward off a double-dip recession, top economist Mark Zandi estimates
text: Moody's Analytics' Mark Zandi estimates what's needed to avert a double-dip recession.

title: Trump: ‘I have no problem’ with face masks
text: President Trump said 'anything that can potentially help is a good thing' and he will continue to wear a face mask.

title: Stock futures flat ahead of major technology earnings
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 150 points on Tuesday.

title: Latest on the next round of fiscal stimulus
text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports on the latest discussions toward a new stimulus bill. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Jeff Mills, Karen Finerman and Chris Verrone.

title: S&P 500 News: Oil Stocks Surge on $2 Trillion EU Stimulus Deal, Will Tesla Join the Index?
text: The S&P 500 Index was relatively flat today, but one segment rocketed higher. In separate news, Tesla could be added to the index if the company can report a profit when it announces its quarterly results Wednesday.

title: U.S. Equities Update: The Trend Is Your Friend
text: Improving upside momentum has both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite ready for another leg higher. The small and mid-cap stocks have been in a tight price range in recent days, and closing above their 200-day averages would be positive.

title: Gold, the US-China Conflict, Covid-19 and Russia
text: In January, progress on the U.S.-China trade deal seemed to calm the trade war between the two countries.

title: Why the Fed has to go bigger: Market strategist
text: CNBC's Kelly Evans discusses the next monetary policy moves the Federal Reserve should consider and what may be next for the U.S. economy amid the pandemic with David Zervos of Jefferies.

title: Stock Markets Finish Mixed; Regional Banks Climb in Surprising Show of Main Street Optimism
text: A bifurcated market continued to pull in opposite directions.

title: Stock Market Today: Energy Stocks Take a Turn in the Spotlight
text: Exxon Mobil (XOM) and Chevron (XOM) led a big Tuesday for energy stocks and other cyclical sectors, and lifted the Dow to modest gains.

title: API data show a climb of more than 7 million barrels in U.S. crude supplies, sources say
text: The American Petroleum Institute reported late Tuesday that U.S. crude supplies rose by 7.5 million barrels for the week ended July 17, according to sources.

title: The Fear of Stock Market Failure
text: The stock market is a big place with thousands of investments that you can make as an investor. It’s a frustrating place.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Tuesday (July 21)
text: Traders booked profits from the major tech names and added to positions in the more beaten-down value stocks.

title: Stocks limp into the close as fiscal stimulus efforts flail
text: U.S. stocks finished mostly higher, slicing early stronger gains in the last hour of trading after hopes faded for a fresh round of fiscal stimulus in the coming week.

title: Dow Jumps 150 Points As Investors Wait For More Coronavirus Stimulus
text: Companies like Coca-Cola and IBM beat earnings on Tuesday.

title: S&P 500 turns positive for 2020, but most stocks are missing the party
text: The benchmark S&P 500 U.S. stock index is now positive for the year, yet most of its components have sat out the rally.

title: Markets will react negatively to a contested U.S. presidential election: Bremmer
text: Ian Bremmer, Eurasia Group president and GZERO Media, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the implications of the presidential election on the stock market.

title: Mohnish Pabrai on Leverage and the Polarized Market
text: Last month, Mohnish Pabrai (Trades, Portfolio) published a Q&A session with Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Asset Management.

title: Next coronavirus relief bill likely in August
text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports on the status of the next round of economic stimulus and presidential candidate Joe Biden's plan for the U.S. economy.

title: Oil futures settle higher, buoyed by the European Union's stimulus package
text: Oil futures climbed Tuesday, with U.S. and global benchmark prices marking their highest finish since March, after the European Union reached a deal on a coronavirus aid package, easing concerns about energy demand.

title: Senate panel approves Trump's Fed nominee Shelton
text: The Senate Banking Committee on Tuesday approved Judy Shelton's nomination to the Federal Reserve Board in a party-line vote, delivering a win for President Donald Trump and his efforts to install a political confidante in a key economic policy-making role.

title: Base metals soar amid economic uncertainty
text: With trillions in stimulus from the U.S. and European Union, many say inflation is inevitable and metal markets are responding.

title: Wall Street gains as investors bet on stimulus
text: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday as a rotation into economically sensitive cyclical stocks reflected optimism that Washington will deliver a new round of stimulus to sustain the U.S. economic recovery from a pandemic-induced recession.

title: EU Rescue Deal Is 'Constructive,' Says PGIM's Sheets
text: Nathan Sheets, PGIM Fixed Income chief economist, talks about the $860 billion stimulus package agreed to by European Union leaders. He appears on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Silver futures log highest finish in over 6 years; gold at highest since 2011
text: Gold and silver futures rallied Tuesday, with haven demand for the precious metals lifting silver to its highest in over six years and gold to levels not seen since 2011.

title: Here’s what’s next for M&A and dealmaking
text: One would reasonably assume that companies are putting the mergers and acquisition plans on hold as the COVID-19 pandemic is showing little sign of slowing down. But that isn’t the case at all, according to Morgan Stanley’s Vice Chairman and Global Head of M&A Robert Kindler Deal activity hasn’t slowed down Morgan Stanley bankers worked on three major and high-profiled deals in 2020, the most recent of which is Analog Devices, Inc.

title: Dow jumps more than 200 points as IBM and Coca-Cola rise after earnings
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team breaks down their investment strategy and whether investors should trim their tech holdings.

title: Tech market has limited upside: Jonathan Krinsky
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team is joined by market technician Jonathan Krinsky of Baycrest Partners to break down how investors should view the tech market's dominance.

title: Here's why mega-cap and tech stocks are outperforming during earnings
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani explains some of the earnings results we've seen during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The Technical Indicator: Charting a bull-flag breakout, S&P 500 extends rally as volatility recedes
text: Technically speaking, the U.S. benchmarks’ bigger-picture backdrop remains bullish, and continues to strengthen, amid recently receding volatility.

title: As U.S. - China tensions ramp up, investors are watching the currency market
text: As the dollar continues its downtrend, China will likely stabilize it’s yuan.

title: Cramer says the stock market could go even higher if more Americans wore coronavirus masks
text: The "Mad Money" host said that wider mask adoption could push stocks tied to state economic reopening plans higher in addition to tech stocks.

title: Global stocks, euro rally after EU agrees to recovery fund
text: World shares rallied to their highest since February and the euro hit its strongest in 17 months on Tuesday after European Union leaders sealed a 750 billion-euro ($857 billion) recovery fund to revive regional economies ravaged by the coronavirus.

title: Why Printing Trillions of Dollars May Not Cause Inflation
text: Central banks and governments around the world have injected stimulus money into the economy at a record pace in an attempt to fend off a global recession. While some prices have increased as supply chains are disrupted, economists and policymakers say inflation could still stay low for a long time.

title: S&P 500, Dow rise on optimism over earnings reports, stimulus
text: The S&P 500 and the Dow indexes rose on Tuesday following a slate of positive earnings reports from companies including IBM and Coca-Cola, and on optimism over an eventual vaccine and fiscal stimulus to revive a pandemic-battered economy.

title: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell lays out plan for next Covid-19 stimulus bill
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports on the latest remarks from Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on the latest round of stimulus.

title: Technically Speaking: 15 Bullish Beliefs (Or Not) For The Market
text: Yesterday, the market broke out of its consolidation range that we have been discussing over the past several weeks.

title: 'People don't want to die for shopping': Cramer on wearing masks
text: CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" crew discuss mask-wearing policies around the United States and what it could mean for businesses and the market.

title: Stocks extend gains at open, Nasdaq hits record intraday high
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead to the day's market action.

title: How Long Will The Fair Price Of Oil Stay Around $40?
text: Billions of investment dollars will be made and lost in oil’s next directional move of $10 or more

title: 'These moves are crazy'—Jim Cramer on Monday's Big Tech rally
text: CNBC's Jim Cramer and the "Squawk on the Street" crew discuss how investors should approach tech stocks' rally.

title: Everything's Gone Green (in the Market)
text: It may not look like it from many angles in the U.S. right now, but it's a very good day to be in the market.
